title: Who is required to send the letter of recommendation to a college, my teacher or me? - Quora

response.answer_text: The letter of recommendation is supposed to be sent by your recommender ( Professor/Supervisor/Manager) whoever has seen you work. The LOR is sent via email to the applied university by the recommender. You will be asked for the email address of your recommender, after submitting their email your recommender will receive the email and will be given some time to send their response about you. Remember the LOR has to be perfect without any flaws (You should take help from professional). You have to be in touch with your recommender during the process.

Conventionally, the professor provided the paper-printed letters to the student and it was student who used to take care of gathering the recommendation letters and send them to the concerned university professors. Right now, the entire scenario is automated and the recommendations are to be made online. It is a two stage process: The student provides the details about the professor along with his/her email address in the university portal.The professor then receives an email from the university portal’s automated system requesting to give the recommendation. It is then the responsibility of the professor to type-in and send the recommendation before the due date.Hope this helps, Sujeevan.
